hjb.http.cmd
Class HJBMessageWriter

java.lang.Object
  hjb.http.cmd.HJBMessageWriter
public class HJBMessageWriter
extends Object

HJBMessageWriter provides methods that convert one or many HJBMessages to text.

A single HJBMessage is represented as follows:
All the headers are written as follows, where CR indicates the platform-specific end-of-line character sequence 

         headerName=headerValue CR
Then a '%' is written by itself: 
          % CR
Finally, the message body is written.

When multiple messages are written at once, each message is written as above, and a '%% ' is used to separate each one. 

          % CR

Author:
Tim Emiola

asMap

public Map asMap(String mapAsText)
          throws HJBException
Returns the map of values represented by mapAsText.

mapAsText is assumed to have been created in a manner similar to that used by asText(Map).

Parameters:
mapAsText - a textual representation of a Map
Returns:
a Map
Throws:
HJBException - if a line occurs that is not in the correct format, or if any other problem occurs
